channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: CISA: Critical SmarterMail RCE Flaw Actively Exploited in Ransomware Attacks
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in SmarterTools' SmarterMail, CVE-2026-24423, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 9.3, allows an unauthenticated attac...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Ransomware, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Issues Directive Forcing Removal of Unsupported Edge Devices from Federal Networks
item.description:
In response to increasing exploitation by nation-state actors, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 26-02. The directive mandates that all Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies inventory and remove all unsupported...

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Betterment Data Breach Exposes 1.4M Customers After Social Engineering Attack
item.description:
Automated investment platform Betterment has disclosed a data breach affecting 1.4 million customers, originating from a sophisticated social engineering attack. Threat actors, claiming to be the 'ShinyHunters' group, used voice phishing (vishing) to manipulate employees and steal Okta single sign-o...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Financial Sector Cyberattacks Doubled in 2025, Fueled by Geopolitical Hacktivism
item.description:
A new report from Check Point Software reveals a dramatic escalation in cyber threats targeting the global financial sector, with incidents more than doubling in 2025. The primary driver was a 105% increase in Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks, which were largely motivated by geopolitical...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical RCE Flaw in n8n Automation Platform Allows Full Server Takeover
item.description:
A critical sandbox escape vulnerability, CVE-2026-25049, has been discovered in the popular n8n workflow automation platform. The flaw, rated 9.4 on the CVSS scale, allows an authenticated user with permission to edit workflows to bypass security controls and execute arbitrary system commands on the...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Milkyway' Ransomware Strain Surfaces with Aggressive Extortion Tactics
item.description:
A new Windows-based ransomware strain named 'Milkyway' has been identified by researchers at CYFIRMA. Currently in a developing state, the malware encrypts files and appends a '.milkyway' extension. It employs aggressive extortion tactics via a full-screen ransom note, threatening not only to leak o...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Japanese Manufacturer Hosokawa Micron
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Hosokawa Micron Corporation, a leading Japanese manufacturer of industrial processing technology. The group announced the breach on an underground forum, threatening to publish approximately 30 GB of exfiltrated confid...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Substack Discloses Data Breach Exposing User Contact Information
item.description:
The newsletter platform Substack has announced it suffered a data breach after discovering on February 3, 2026, that an unauthorized party had gained access to a database containing user information. The exposed data includes names, email addresses, phone numbers, and Stripe IDs, though the company ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cisco and F5 Release Urgent Patches for High-Severity DoS and RCE Vulnerabilities
item.description:
Networking giants Cisco and F5 have released a wave of security updates to address multiple high-severity vulnerabilities across their product lines. Cisco patched five flaws, including a remote DoS bug in TelePresence/RoomOS (CVE-2026-20119) and a root-level command execution flaw in Meeting Manage...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese APT 'Amaranth-Dragon' Hits Southeast Asian Governments with WinRAR Exploit
item.description:
A newly identified China-linked APT group, dubbed 'Amaranth-Dragon,' is conducting targeted cyber espionage campaigns against government and law enforcement agencies in Southeast Asia. The group, believed to be affiliated with the broader APT41 ecosystem, is exploiting a known WinRAR vulnerability (...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Voicemail-Themed Phishing Campaign Deploys Legitimate RMM Tools for Backdoor Access
item.description:
A widespread social engineering campaign is using convincing voicemail-themed lures to trick victims into installing legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software. The attack begins with an email, often from a bank-themed subdomain, leading to a webpage that prompts the user to 'listen ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Mandates TLS 1.2 for Azure Blob Storage, Sunsetting Older Versions
item.description:
Microsoft has officially deprecated support for Transport Layer Security (TLS) versions 1.0 and 1.1 for its Azure Blob Storage service, effective February 3, 2026. TLS 1.2 is now the minimum required version for all new and existing blob storage accounts across all Azure clouds. This mandatory secur...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'Shadow Campaign' Hacks Governments in 37 Countries, China-Linked Group Suspected
item.description:
Security researchers have uncovered a massive, long-running cyber-espionage operation dubbed 'Shadow Campaign.' The campaign is attributed to a suspected Chinese nation-state group, TGR-STA-1030, and has successfully compromised at least 70 government and critical infrastructure organizations in 37 ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Futile Ransom: Nitrogen Ransomware Contains Fatal Coding Error, Decryption Impossible
item.description:
In a case of profound operational failure, security researchers have discovered a fatal coding error in the Nitrogen ransomware group's malware that targets VMware ESXi systems. The flaw, found in the encryption routine, causes the malware to use the wrong public key during the encryption process. A...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Criticized for Silently Updating KEV Catalog with Ransomware Data
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is facing criticism for its practice of silently updating its Known Exploited Vulnerability (KEV) catalog. In 2025, the agency updated 59 entries to indicate that the flaws were being used in ransomware attacks, but it did not issue an...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive AT&T Customer Dataset with 148M SSNs Resurfaces in Criminal Circles
item.description:
A massive and highly sensitive dataset allegedly containing the personal information of AT&T customers has resurfaced and is being circulated in criminal forums. The data trove reportedly includes approximately 176 million records, featuring over 133 million full names and addresses, and, most criti...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: LinkedIn Phishing Campaign Targets Executives Using Legitimate Pen-Testing Tools
item.description:
A new phishing campaign discovered by ReliaQuest is abusing LinkedIn's private messaging feature to target executives and IT professionals. The attackers use social engineering to trick victims into downloading and running a malicious archive file. The attack's novelty lies in its use of a legitimat...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Fake LINE Messenger Installer Spreads ValleyRAT Malware
item.description:
A malware campaign attributed to the Silver Fox APT group is distributing the ValleyRAT remote access trojan by disguising it as an installer for the popular LINE messaging app. The campaign, which primarily targets Chinese-speaking users, uses the trojanized software as a lure to infect systems. On...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Actor, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Flaws in Django Framework Expose Sites to DoS and SQL Injection
item.description:
The maintainers of the Django web framework have released important security updates to address critical vulnerabilities. The flaws could allow remote attackers to conduct Denial-of-Service (DoS) and potential SQL injection attacks against web applications built with the framework. Due to the severi...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: Critical RCE Flaw in Ingress-NGINX Threatens Kubernetes Clusters
item.description:
A critical vulnerability has been discovered in the widely used Ingress-NGINX controller for Kubernetes. The flaw could allow a remote attacker to achieve arbitrary code execution within the context of the ingress controller. A successful exploit could lead to a full compromise of the ingress, enabl...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Samsung's February 2026 Update Fixes 37 Flaws in Galaxy Devices
item.description:
Samsung has released its February 2026 security update for its Galaxy smartphones, tablets, and foldable devices. The update addresses a total of 37 vulnerabilities. This includes 25 patches from Google for the core Android OS and 12 Samsung-specific patches (SVEs) for its One UI software. The Samsu...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Google Patches Multiple Vulnerabilities in February 2026 Pixel Update
item.description:
Google has released its monthly security update for all supported Pixel devices as part of its February 2026 patch cycle. The update addresses numerous security vulnerabilities detailed in the Android and Pixel-specific security bulletins. Installing the update will bring all supported Pixel devices...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK Law Criminalizing AI-Generated Deepfake Intimate Images Takes Effect
item.description:
A new law in the United Kingdom is set to come into force on February 6, 2026, making it a criminal offense to create or share AI-generated 'deepfake' intimate images of an adult without their consent. The law, part of the Data (Use and Access) Act 2025, amends the Sexual Offences Act 2003 to specif...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Notepad++ Update Mechanism Hijacked in 6-Month Supply Chain Attack by Chinese APT
item.description:
The maintainers of the widely-used Notepad++ text editor have disclosed a major supply chain attack that compromised their update infrastructure for six months in 2025. The attack, attributed to the Chinese espionage group Lotus Blossom (Billbug), involved hijacking update requests to selectively de...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Claims Breach of Tulsa International Airport, Leaks Data
item.description:
The Russian-affiliated Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Tulsa International Airport. The group has listed the airport on its data leak site, alleging the theft of sensitive data including financial records and employee information. While airport operations ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Sophisticated Phishing Attack Uses PDF Lures and Cloud Services to Steal Dropbox Credentials
item.description:
A new, multi-stage phishing campaign is using procurement-themed emails with benign-looking PDF attachments to bypass email security filters. The attack chain redirects victims through a legitimate cloud service, Vercel Blob, before presenting a convincing fake Dropbox login page. The goal is to har...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Canada Computers Discloses Data Breach Affecting Guest Checkout Customers
item.description:
Canada Computers Inc., a major Canadian electronics retailer, has announced a data breach that exposed the personal and credit card information of customers. The incident affected individuals who used the 'guest' checkout feature on the company's website between December 29, 2025, and January 22, 20...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Play Ransomware Hits US Instrument Manufacturer Deatak in Data Breach
item.description:
The Play ransomware group has claimed another victim in the manufacturing sector, listing U.S.-based instrument maker Deatak on its data breach forum. The attackers allege they have compromised and exfiltrated a wide range of private and confidential data, including client documents, employee payrol...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

item.title: INC Ransomware Group Breaches Two U.S. Law Firms, Leaks Sensitive Client Data
item.description:
The INC ransomware group is actively targeting the U.S. legal sector, claiming responsibility for attacks on at least two law firms: Hawk Law Group and Eisenberg Lowrance Lundell Lofgren. The group alleges it has stolen highly sensitive client information, including data related to civil and crimina...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attack Cripples City of New Britain, CT, Forcing Manual Operations
item.description:
A ransomware attack has caused significant and ongoing disruption to the municipal network systems of New Britain, Connecticut. The attack, which began last week and was later confirmed as ransomware, has impacted the city's entire internet server. As a result, city departments have been forced to a...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Incident Response
